channel.title: Home on PinGod AddOns
channel.description: Recent content in Home on PinGod AddOns

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: The following guides aim to have you up and running the BasicGameGodot window from the pingod-basicgame. Install, setup Godot Configure Godot Basic Game Setup Basic Game Visual Pinball

item.title: Plugins - Autoload
item.description: Most PinGod Godot plugins are included in the addons/AutoLoad directory. These plug-ins (addons) are used to enable certain features or disable them completely for when you want to develop scenes on their own for instance. These should work in any order you enable them. When you enable one then this is added to the Autoload in Project Settings. Plugin Description WindowActions Helper to use keys with window, switches, should always be enabled to close with ESC and F2 to move window Adjustments Global adjustments so your scene scripts can use global variables or settings Resources async loading of scenes, stores packed scenes and loads packs etc Machine Plugin to hold all the machine items and do other things like switch handling MemoryMap Windows memory mapped file for sharing states with a simulator or other applications AudioManager Load audio assets and play PinGodGame Main game framework Overriding the autoload scenes The autoload folder in the game directory is used when you want to override the AutoLoad scenes.

item.title: BasicGame - Scenes Overview
item.description: An overview of the parts used to create the BasicGame with PinGod. These should give you a good idea of how to use these in your game and a good starting base. Main Scene Attract Scene Game Scene Score Mode Scene Base Mode Scene Bonus Mode Scene Score Entry Scene Tilt Scene

item.title: Tools / Controls
item.description: Tools are custom add on objects in Godot. You can use the attribute [Tool] and turn a script into a tool. They will be available to search and select from in Godot so you can add to your scenes.

item.title: Tip / Guides / Notes
item.description: Anything we find useful to you will go here. Any tips, tutorials.

item.description: How to setup localization to have any language in your game.

item.title: P-ROC - PinGod NetProc
item.description: Using PinGodGame and NetProc to run with a P-ROC board. This version of PinGod is quite similar to the example without a P-ROC, only this uses modes and handles machine items differentley. Games can be simulated and developed away from the machine with a simulator (visual pinball) or using the playfield window. Overview Overview of what we get from using NetProc: PinProc Controller (send data to board USB) Game Controller Modes (with or without CanvasLayers) Databased machine items, adjustments and audits Trough Management (Mode) Ball Search, Ball Save (Modes) P-ROC Links ðŸ”— multimorphic.
